thread.title: East Bridgewater runs over Abington
thread.title_full: East Bridgewater runs over Abington | Boston Herald

author: Dan Keats
title: East Bridgewater runs over Abington
text:
With its starting quarterback sidelined by an injury and facing soggy weather conditions less than conducive to throwing the ball, East Bridgewater called on its offensive line to open holes for the running game.
And the big blockers up front answered the call as the Vikings (4-0) accumulated almost 300 rushing yards yesterday and powered past host Abington , 21-0, in a South Shore League Large football game.
Running back Jared Vargus carried the ball 20 times for 180 yards and a touchdown. Quarterback Jake Peterson added 101 rushing yards and scored twice with 18 carries.
“They came out today with a purpose and definitely helped us run well,” Vargus said about his teammate in the trenches.
The East Bridgewater defense controlled the line of scrimmage in a similar fashion, limiting Abington (3-1) to 137 yards and never allowing the Green Wave to get inside the 25-yard line.
The Vikings defensive front made a big stand on the opening series of the game, stopping Abington three times as it attempted to gain 1 yard it needed at the East Bridgewater 38.
“Mike Chaupetta and Eric Marchant, our defensive tackles, and two senior captains for us, they had a rough game last year playing (Abington) in the (Div. 5) South final, so they took a lot of this personal and just made sure they did their job,” East Bridgewater coach Shawn Tarpey said. “When they do their job, they’re so big and strong, they have a big impact moving out from the middle of that defense.”
Vargus finished off the ensuing six-play, 68-yard drive with a 17-yard TD.
Peterson added a 4-yard TD run midway through the second quarter for a 14-0 halftime lead and then sealed it with a 20-yard score in the fourth.
Elsewhere in the South Shore League, John Goode and Ryan Shea rushed for second-half touchdowns and the defense did the rest for Rockland (2-2) in a 14-0 victory against Carver .
Boys soccer
Jerry Ozor scored twice and added an assist as Milton Academy (5-0) shut out Thayer , 4-0, in an Independent School League clash.
In Catholic Central action, Brian St. Croix scored his eighth of the season and it was the only tally during a 1-0 win by Archbishop Williams (6-1) over Bishop Fenwick (4-3-1).
Girls soccer
Carey Allard scored twice as Belmont (4-3) defeated Reading , 2-0, in the Middlesex League. . . . Marissa Gatusso scored twice with the second goal serving as the winner at :20 to play for Woburn (6-1-2) in a 2-1 triumph over Lexington .
In Northeastern Conference action, Brianna Gaynor netted a pair of goals and added an assist to power Peabody (7-0) past Winthrop , 6-0.
Liz Dumas had the lone goal as Brookline (4-3-2) edged winless Framingham , 1-0, in the Bay State Conference.
Field hockey
Jess Falvo scored a goal as Waltham (1-5) defeated Bedford , 2-1, in Dual County League play.
Chanel Bullock netted a goal as Manchester Essex (8-1) blanked North Reading , 4-0, in a Cape Ann League game.
Kevin Barrucci and Matt Feld contributed to this report.
